result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Brellenthin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of School.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with victim, Melanie G.
Attend Domestic Abuse Counseling.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael R Brellenthin in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk swears defendant. Waiver of right to an Attorney addressed.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Withheld sentence for 8 months Probation
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVSurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No violent contact with victim Melanie G..  Domestic Violence Counseling.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael R Brellenthin in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant advises the Court that he has chosen not to retain counsel.  The Defendant is to contact the District Attorney's office regarding pretrial offer.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.   Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim listed in the complaint.

Defendant Michael R Brellenthin in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
